description: In this tutorial we show how to train a Machine Learning Model for predicting the band-gap of Materials containing Si and Ge, by making use of the Exabyte Machine Learning Engine.
title: Exabyte.io Tutorial: Train Machine Learning Model

youTubeCaptions.text: Create a simulation, by navigating to the job designer page.
Then, <break time='0.5' />  select and import the set of materials comprised of silicon and Germanium, <break time='0.5' /> constituting our training set.

Then, <break time='0.5' /> navigate to the Workflow tab, and select the 'ML Train Model' workflow, which we use to train a Machine Learning Model for predicting the electronic band-gap of Materials composed of silicon and germanium, by making use of the Exabyte Machine Learning Engine.
Let us now inspect the 'input' compute unit.
The properties which will be predicted by the trained model are the target properties which have been ticked under this unit, in this case the band gaps.
Then, <break time='0.5' /> set the name for the job. <break time='0.5' /> Here, we call it - <sub alias='S i  G e '>SiGe</sub> Band Gap ML Train.
Next, <break time='0.5' /> save the job. <break time='3.0' /> It can then be selected and submitted to the compute queue, for execution. <break time='4.0' />
When the job is finished, open it, to inspect the resulting trained model workflow. <break time='4.0' />
Let us open the 'score' unit of this trained workflow. <break time='0.5' /> Here, the model coefficients and importance are stored, together with an indication of the model precision.

Now we navigate back to our workflow collection, via the left-hand sidebar of the web interface. <break time='0.5' /> The generated workflow containing the trained model can thus be retrieved among the collection entries.
